Mingle lang v1.3
  • All Classes
 

All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary Exception Summary 
    Class Description
    Cancellable
    Cancellable interface.
    Chronometer
    Reports the time elapsed since the instance was created or the last call to ::reset().
    CodeError
    CodeError: an error showed up during parsing, lexing, transpiling, etc.
    CommandSerializer
    Serializes ICommand instances.
    Config  
    Cron
    A Linux-like Cron extended to be Mingle-like.
    date  
    Dispatcher<T>
    Dispatcher class manages a queue of items which are processed asynchronously.
    ExEnComm
    ExEn can receive the requests (commands) defined in this class.
    ExEn reacts to every command by executing the appropriate action(s).
    ExEnComm.Request
    Requests that ExEn handles: they arrive from outside via network.
    ExtraType<T>
    Extra types: Must implement UneSerializable Can have only one constructor and it must have following signature: clazz( Object...args )
    ExtraTypeCollection<T>  
    GridNode  
    ICandi
    Interface for all Compilers and all Interpreters except Une transpiler.
    ICandi.IBuilder  
    ICandi.IError  
    ICandi.ILanguage  
    ICandi.IPrepared
    This interface contains foreign (not Une) code ready to be used by the Mingle ExEn: it is compiled code for languages like Java or C or the source code itself for JS and others.
    ICmdEncDecLib
    An interface for Command Encoding and Decoding Library.
    ICmdKeys
    The commands values as appear in their JSON serialization.
    ICommand
    Base interface for: Device, Driver, Rule and Script commands.
    IConfig  
    IController
    A controller is the piece of software that deals with the physical world.

    A controller, can be written in any programming language: Java, C, Python, JavaScript, ...

    Note: OOP Polymorphism is avoided here in method names because some languages (like JS) do not allow it.
    IController.Listener  
    IDevice  
    IDriver
    A driver is the link that connects Mingle with the physical world.
    IEventBus  
    IEventBus.Listener<T extends Message>  
    ILogger  
    ILogger.Level  
    INetClient
    Interface that every communications client must implement.
    INetClient.IListener
    The listener that receives the messages from the channel (the server-side).
    INetServer
    Interface that every communications server must implement.
    INetServer.IListener
    The listener that receives the messages.
    IRule
    To manually trigger a RULE, a message of class MsgExecute has to be sent to the bus.
    IRule.IAction
    An action associated with a RULE.
    IRuntime
    This interface represents the ExEn public API.
    An instance of this is passed to every RunTime Command: SCRIPT, DRIVER, DEVICE and RULE.
    IScript  
    ITokenable  
    IXprEval
    This interface represents an expression evaluator with the minimum needed requirements.
    Language  
    Lexeme
    Merely a data structure that holds lexemes recognized by the Lexer.
    Lexer
    A tokenizer (lexer) for the Une language.
    list
    In Une, lists are 1 based instead of 0 based.
    ListenerWise<T>
    A base class to save code and effort when implementing a class that uses listeners.
    Logger
    This class allows to easily work with logging tasks in applications.
    Message
    This is the base class for all messages that are known by the ExEn.
    MingleException  
    MsgAbstractOne
    The Virtual World requests to change an Actuator in Real (physical) World.
    MsgAbstractTwo
    The Virtual World requests to change an Actuator in Real (physical) World.
    MsgChangeActuator
    The Virtual World requests to change an Actuator in Real (physical) World.
    MsgDeviceChanged
    A Controller or another grid node sent this message: if it was sent by another node, the device effectively got a new value.
    MsgDeviceReaded
    A Device changed in real world (or in a different grid node).
    When changed in real world, the Driver receives this message from the Device's Controller.
    When changed in another ExEn, the message is received from this ExEn.
    MsgError
    An error happened (most part of the time at Controllers that are who deal with physical world).
    MsgReadDevice
    Requests to the IDriver (which request to IController) to read current device's value.

    This is used just when a device is created to find out its value.
    MsgTrigger
    Request the execution of an SCRIPT or RULE's actions (unconditionally).
    NAXE
    NAXE : Not Another eXpression Evaluator (do not change this name).
    OneToMany<K,​V>  
    Operable<T>
    date and time classes (in this module) implement this interface.
    Operator<T>
    This class instances represent operators: Arithmetic, Relational and Conditional.
    pair
    A simple dictionary: key/value pairs; where key must be a basic Une data type: String, Number or Boolean.
    Pair<K,​V>
    A simple thread-safe pair of key and value structure.
    RateMonitor
    This class is designed to detect if events are happening too fast.
    It stores a specified number of event timestamps and checks if the time elapsed between the first and last event is equal to or exceeds a specified threshold.
    StdXprFns
    Une Standard Expressions Functions.
    StdXprOps
    Une Standard Expressions Operators.
    time
    Creates a new instance of this class, which represents a local time.
    UtilANSI  
    UtilCLI
    Command Line Interface parser.
    UtilColls  
    UtilComm
    This class has a bunch of utility methods to deal with common communications issues.
    UtilComm.Protocol  
    UtilIO  
    UtilIO.FileWriter  
    UtilJson  
    UtilReflect  
    UtilStr  
    UtilSys
    Utility class providing system-level operations and services for the Mingle framework.
    UtilType  
    UtilUnit
    Internally Mingle only uses Float for numbers.
    XprTokenizer
    Yet another tokenizer.
    It produces as many token as needed to represent passed expression.
